channel.title: Hybridscape on Moparscape
channel.description: im just curious since hybridscape is the default server that comes with your moparscape download, i was curious if you could take that out and paste any other server sources in there and run them through moparscape offline?.

item.title: Hybridscape on Moparscape
item.dc:creator: @Kegels Kegels
item.description:
@Kegels wrote:

yes i am on windows XP, as you can tell i am very new to this so i appreciate all the help. well i ran the run.bat and it went though just find it said its listening in on port 43594. but when i go into moparscape do i just put in my IP to connect to it or what?

Read full topic

item.title: Hybridscape on Moparscape
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Are you on windows or what? I should probably point out that the clients (I think that’s what you meant by GUI?) are sometimes not included with the servers. If you’re on windows, to start the server you usually just double click run.bat, and a little black run box will pop up. Unless it tells you there is an error, your server is started.

As for the client, I suggest you look for a ‘508 ip changer’ client, which you can run (again usually a run.bat file) and then type in your LAN IP address to connect to.

Read full topic

item.title: Hybridscape on Moparscape
item.dc:creator: @Kegels Kegels
item.description:
@Kegels wrote:

ive tried this with DangerZone[508] and when i hit run it couldn’t find the GUI folder, i also tried this with DemoniaxScape 562 and it doesnt receive caches to even start up, i have the worst luck with servers… haha

Read full topic

item.title: Hybridscape on Moparscape
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I suggest you follow the ‘How to start a server’ tutorial in the tutorial section (and download a 508 source or w/e), but skip the port forwarding section. Then when you get to the client part you change it to your LAN address.

Read full topic

item.title: Hybridscape on Moparscape
item.dc:creator: @Kegels Kegels
item.description:
@Kegels wrote:

ive LAN’d with hybridscape but its so lame i wanna LAN with a 508 or something with more things like gwd or something, i know how to add NPCs and stuff to hyrbidscape but you can’t really do much with that. haha That’s why i was wondering if i could add a server into the moparscape folder and run it through moparscape so i could host with that server and then connect to that game in LAN through moparscape through another computer?.

Read full topic

item.title: Hybridscape on Moparscape
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Lucky for you, that’s perfectly possible

Just don’t portfoward, and instead of using your external IP address to connect from other computers, use your LAN address.

For example, if you’re hosting the server on local computer 192.168.0.10, you use that local address to connect to it from your other computers.

Read full topic

item.title: Hybridscape on Moparscape
item.dc:creator: @Kegels Kegels
item.description:
@Kegels wrote:

i was kinda thinking more for LAN purposes if thats possible?

Read full topic

item.title: Hybridscape on Moparscape
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

The only way to really host a server ‘offline’ is to disconnect your computer from the internet. But if you just mean so other people can’t connect, usually you can add a host check in your server or just not port forward. Most people have problems with port forwarding anyway so that shouldn’t be a problem!

Read full topic

item.title: Hybridscape on Moparscape
item.dc:creator: @Kegels Kegels
item.description:
@Kegels wrote:

i was just wondering, because ive tried to download lots of sources and run them offline and i have no idea how to, and moparscape was the only thing i could get to run offline. but thanks anyways i appreciate your reply. (:

Read full topic

item.title: Hybridscape on Moparscape
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

It loads the folder by name, so no, not really. And it would be pointless to do so, as you can run any source on the correct port and connect from the Moparscape client, which is part of how it’s so cool and dynamic.

In other words, you don’t need to run the server from inside the client to use it.

Read full topic
